newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH '96 TAX REVENUE MAY EXCEED BUDGET - OFFICIAL.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH '96 TAX REVENUE MAY EXCEED BUDGET - OFFICIAL.

text.p: An official at the Finnish finance ministry's budget department said on Thursday it was likely that state 1996 tax and tax-related revenues would reach, possibly even exceed, the budgeted 124 billion markka.
"Recently, the positive signs have outperformed the negative ones," the official told Reuters by telephone. "I think we are well on track to meet the target, we might even go a bit over."

The budget department official was asked to comment on a report in business daily Kauppalehti, which on Thursday quoted an official at the ministry's economics department as saying the expected tax and tax-related revenue target could be exceeded.
"The expected 124 billion markka can be exceeded, but not by much," the economics department official was quoted as saying.
In January-October, state tax and tax-related revenues were 102.03 billion markka, up 17.7 percent year-on-year.
